data.description: The scope of this document is limited to the Reference Release Definition of SyncML Primer according to OMA Release process and the Reference Release document baseline listed in section 5.

This document is intended to help newcomers to understand OMA Data Sync (also known as SyncML DS) protocol and to select the appropriate release enabler they would like to implement. This document might also help developers to migrate from release 1.1.2 to 1.2, in that it will outline the feature differences between various releases. This document is informative, and is not intended to add requirements to current OMA DS and OMA SyncML Common specifications.

This document is designed to introduce OMA Data Synchronization standard, also known as SyncML or OMA DS, and define its capabilities. The reader will also find in this document a brief history of the standard and an outline of its technical and commercial benefits. For further information about OMA DS standard change history, please refer to [HISTORY]. For more in-depth information on OMA DS, the reader will find references of books and specification documents in the next section. This document is informative and is not intended to add requirements to current OMA DS and OMA SyncML Common specifications.
